H0.text: Trisomy 21 is the most common cause of Down syndrome.

H1.text: Trisomy 22 is the most common cause of Down syndrome.

H2.text: Gametes 21 are the most common cause of Down syndrome.

H3.text: Chromosome 21 is the most common cause of Down syndrome.

A4.text: The most common cause (about 92â€“95% of cases) is a complete extra copy of chromosome 21, resulting in trisomy 21.

A5.text: Trisomy 21: 94% of the time Down syndrome is caused by an extra copy of chromosome 21 in all cells
